page.title: 03Bourton's Attractions (1)
page.content: Of the many attractions in Bourton- on-the-Water,{Birdland}is perhaps the best known. Set in a{beautiful garden, created by Leonard Hill, a local builder, who collected{exotic birds from all over the world - Macaws, Toucans, Cockatoos, Cranes, and Flamingoes - but especially the{South {Sea Penguins}which may be seen through underwater viewing. There is also a Tropical House with Humming Birds, a unique Shell-Land and an{Art Gallery and{Museum.}Another popular attraction is the{Model Village}in the garden of the Old New Inn, owned by a well known local family. It is a replica of Bourton and was started in 1936 by the landlord, Mr. Morris, with the help of six local craftsmen. Each building has been reproduced on a one-ninth scale. The organ plays in the church and the mill wheel on the Windrush revolves.
